alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:09AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MIDDAY THURSDAY THROUGH LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Converse County Lower Elevations, Niobrara County, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, East Platte County and Goshen County. * WHEN...From 11 AM MST Thursday morning through 11 PM MST Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold temperatures are expected to be present on Friday and Friday night. Impacts to local agriculture, including the ranching community are possible as wind chills near or below zero will be present.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Additional areas across southeast Wyoming and the Nebraska Panhandle may be included in winter weather headlines with future forecast updates.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
